# [`options()`]{.blue}
 
 
### 
[options]{.blue}(*option* = *value*){.center} 
 
# What it does 

+ The [`options()`]{.blue} function sets the global behavior used by R, including how numbers are printed/formatted.  
+ Some packages allow you to set default behavior.
  + For example, you can turn off messages about how [`summarise()`]{.blue} function behaves in [`dplyr`]{.blue} with this option:
  
 
# Demo code 

```{r}
options(dplyr.summarise.inform = FALSE)
```
